doc.field: Time Inc. Fortune Publishing and Business Records
Time Inc. Fortune Publishing and Business Records
Subseries V.D. Wall Street Week with Fortune
Subseries V.D. Wall Street Week with Fortune
The Wall Street Week with Fortune subseries contains materials from 2002 to 2003. Included in the subseries are videotapes with recordings of episodes of the show.

Originally launched as Wall Street Week with Louis Rukeyser in 1972, the show ran under this name from 1972 to 2002. During a revamp in 2002, original host, Louis Rukeyser, was replaced in an attempt to attract a younger audience. Relaunched as Wall Street Week with Fortune, it was now a joint venture between Fortune, Maryland Public Television, and PBS. The new hosts of the show were Geoffrey Colvin, the editorial director of Fortune, and Karen Gibbs, who was previously a senior business correspondent for Fox News. The host, along with panelists, would discuss financial markets, the economy, and financial issues in an attempt to help keep investors informed about developments. Despite attempts to grow the audience, the show was canceled in 2005.

Ives, Nat. "'Wall St. Week,' a PBS Staple, Will Go Off the Air in June." The New York Times. March 24, 2005. Accessed January 04, 2019. https://www.nytimes.com/2005/03/24/business/media/wall-st-week-a-pbs-staple-will-go-off-the-air-in-june.html

"Wall $treet Week with Louis Rukeyser." IMDb. Accessed January 04, 2019. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0255766/
